Description: MongoDB warns that its corporate systems were breached and that customer data was exposed in a cyberattack that was detected by the company earlier this week.

Author: QakBot
Target: Multiple Organizations in the Hospitality Sector
Description: Researchers from Microsoft warn that QakBot is being distributed again in a phishing campaign pretending to be an email from an IRS employee.
An unknown criminal group puts on sale access to a wide range of live feeds from various security cameras in Vietnam.
Peer-to-peer trading platform NFT Trader falls victim to a security breach resulting in the theft of nearly $3 million in non-fungible tokens.

Target: Users of the WordPress Hosting Provider Kinsta
Description: WordPress hosting provider Kinsta warns customers that Google ads have been observed promoting phishing sites to steal hosting credentials.

Author: MedusaLocker
Description: The MedusaLocker ransomware gang adds Biomatrix to their leak site.

Comcast Cable Communications, doing business as Xfinity, discloses that attackers who breached one of its Citrix servers in October also stole customer-sensitive information of over 35 million people from its systems.
A ransomware attack hits Milton Town School District.

Author: Predatory Sparrow
Description: A cyberattack disrupts the operation of 70% of gas stations throughout Iran. An Israel-linked group called Predatory Sparrow claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Smishing Triad
Target: UAE residents and foreigners living in or visiting the country
Description: Researchers from Resecurity identify a new fraudulent campaign by the Smishing Triad Gang in which they are impersonating the United Arab Emirates Federal Authority for Identity and Citizenship, via malicious SMS messages that pretend to be on behalf of the General Directorate of Residency and Foreigners Affairs, targeting UAE residents and foreigners living in or visiting the country.
Researchers from AT&T Alien Labs uncover a previously undetected Go-based information stealer dubbed JaskaGO, targeting both Windows and macOS systems.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a scam promising easy money for simply watching Youtube videos.

ZOLL Medical Corporation (ZOLL) notifies some ZOLL employees, dependents and beneficiaries that their protected health information (PHI) may have been accessed by an unauthorized party after a ZOLL employee was the victim of a sophisticated email phishing attack.

Erie Family Health Centers confirms that the protected health information of 6,351 patients was potentially accessed or obtained by an unknown threat actor who gained access to the email account of one of its employees.

Bellin Health announces that an unauthorized third party gained access to its internal systems and may have viewed or acquired the information of patients who purchased home care equipment between 2006 and 2013.

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: National Securities and Stock Market Commission in Ukraine
Description: The Russian threat actors from the NoName057(16) group claim to have taken down the National Securities and Stock Market Commission in Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Russian threat actors from the NoName057(16) group claim to have taken down Accordbank in Ukraine.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Russian threat actors from the NoName057(16) group claim to have taken down Unex Bank in Ukraine.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Russian threat actors from the NoName057(16) group claim to have taken down Energy Community in Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Russian threat actors from the NoName057(16) group claim to have taken down Velta in Ukraine.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware group claims to have targeted Viking Therapeutics.

Target: Over 50,000 users of 40 banks in North America, South America, Europe, and Japan
Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force uncover a new malware campaign using JavaScript web injections to try to steal the banking data of over 50,000 users of 40 banks in North America, South America, Europe, and Japan.

Author: Handala
Description: The Israel National Cyber Directorate (INCD) warns of phishing emails pretending to be F5 BIG-IP zero-day security updates that deploy Windows and Linux data wipers. A pro-Palestinian hacktivist group named Handala claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: yeremyvalidslov2342
Description: Researchers from ReversingLabs discover a campaign using a novel technique through GitHub gists to host the command and control infrastructure.
Researchers from ReversingLabs discover a malicious campaign abusing the GitHub version control system features to host the command and control.

Author: Seedworm (aka Muddywater)
Target: Telecommunications companies in Egypt, Sudan and Tanzania,
Description: Researchers from Broadcom/Symantec discover a campaign carried on by the cyber-espionage group Seedworm, linked to Iran’s intelligence service, targeting telecommunications companies in Egypt, Sudan and Tanzania via the MuddyC2Go framework and a custom keylogger.

Author: Cloud Atlas
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover a new campaign from the threat group known as Cloud Atlas, targeting a Russian agro-industrial enterprise in a new espionage campaign.

Author: Cloud Atlas
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover a new campaign from the threat group known as Cloud Atlas, targeting a state-owned research company in a new espionage campaign.
Researchers from Zscaler reveal that threat actors are exploiting an old Microsoft Office vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2017-11882, as part of phishing campaigns to spread the Agent Tesla malware.

The Student Loans Company (SLC) warns UK students of an ongoing phishing campaign impersonating the company where scammers tell students to expect a call from a private number to verify their payment details.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new malvertising campaign delivering the MetaStealer malware via malicious search ads.
Kimco Staffing Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access the company’s IT network.

Researchers from Trustwave discover a phishing campaign pretending to be a 'copyright infringement' email from the parent company Meta, to steal the backup codes of Instagram users, allowing the attackers to bypass the two-factor authentication configured on the account.
Cryptocurrency scammers are abusing a legitimate Twitter "feature" to promote scams, fake giveaways, and fraudulent Telegram channels used to steal crypto and NFTs.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Google releases emergency updates to fix CVE-2023-7024, another Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Researchers from ReasonLabs discover three malicious Chrome extensions posing as VPN downloaded 1.5 million times, acting as browser hijackers, cashback hack tools, and data stealers, and delivered in pirated copies of popular video games like Grand Theft Auto, Assassins Creed, and The Sims 4.
Indian information technology company HCL Technologies reports a ransomware attack to regulators, saying that it is investigating the incident.

Author: IT Army of Ukraine
Description: Hacktivists from the IT Army of Ukraine claim they disrupted the operations of Bitrix24, a Russian provider of customer relationship management (CRM) services.
Liberty Hospital struggles to provide care to patients after an alleged ransomware attack limited its systems.

Author: BLACKJACK
Description: Hacktivists from the pro-Ukraine collective BLACKJACK claim to have launched an attack on Rosvodokanal, the largest private water utility in Russia, and to have stolen documents, encrypted 6,000 computers, and deleted 50 Tb of data.
Researchers from Netskope discover a  campaign, exploiting a Word document to deliver a malicious backdoor written in the programming language Nim, and targeting Nepalese government organizations.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Sophos uncover a novel targeted malspam operation deploying password-stealing malware variants such as Redline Stealer or Vidar Stealer, targeting the hospitality industry.

Target: Android users in India’s financial landscape.
Description: Researchers from McAfee discover a banking trojan, named Android/Banker.AFX, targeting users in India’s financial landscape.
Lake County Health Department investigates a security incident involving unauthorized access to an employee’s email account.

Author: UAC-0099
Target: Ukrainian employees working outside of the country.
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct identify a new cyber campaign targeting Ukrainian employees working outside of the country, and exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability and delivering a malware strain, named LONEPAGE.
Researchers from ThreatFabric reveal that the Chameleon Android banking trojan has re-emerged with a new version that uses disables fingerprint and face unlock to steal device PINs.
First American Financial Corporation, the second-largest title insurance company in the United States, takes some of its systems offline to contain the impact of a cyberattack.

Author: APT33 a.k.a Peach Sandstorm, HOLMIUM, or Refined Kitten
Target: Organizations in the Defense Industrial Base (DIB) sector.
Description: Researchers from Microsoft say that the APT33 Iranian cyber-espionage group is using recently discovered FalseFont backdoor malware to attack defense contractors worldwide.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from ScamSniffer reveal that Google and Twitter ads are promoting sites containing a cryptocurrency drainer named 'MS Drainer' that has already stolen $59 million from 63,210 victims over the past nine months.

Author: Mutiple threat actors
Description: The US cybersecurity agency CISA releases an industrial control system (ICS) advisory for CVE-2023-49897, a vulnerability affecting Future X Communications (FXC) routers, currently exploited in the wild.

Author: Mutiple threat actors
Description: The US cybersecurity agency CISA releases an industrial control system (ICS) advisory for  CVE-2023-47565, a vulnerability affecting QNAP network video recorder (NVR) devices, currently exploited in the wild.
Researchers from NCC reveal to have observed the banking malware Carbanak deployed in ransomware attacks.
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign delivering the DarkGate malware, named BattleRoyal, and exploiting the CVE-2023-36025 vulnerability.

Author: Threat actors from Pakistan
Target: Indian government entities and the defense sector
Description: Researchers from SEQRITE unveil Operation RusticWeb, a campaign targeting Indian government entities and the defense sector using a Rust-based malware for intelligence gathering.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: First Choice Dental files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential patient information was subject to unauthorized access.
Middlefield Banking Company (Middlefield Bank) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was the victim of a recent cyberattack.
Security 1st Title files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s IT network.
Fresno Surgical Hospital files a notice of data after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its computer network as the result of a cyberattack
College of the Canyons warns more than 2,400 affected personnel of a data breach through Keenan & Associates, its insurance provider.

Researchers from Kela discover a massive phishing campaigns abusing over 185,000 compromised accounts, obtained through malware, associated with Booking.com, impersonating property owners to target Booking.com customers.

Author: WereWolves
Description: A new ransomware group named WereWolves emerges claiming 21 victims in multiple countries.
Country: DE FR NL RS RU US MK

Description: Europol notifies over 400 websites that their online shops have been hacked with malicious scripts, including ATMZOW, health_check, FirstKiss, FakeGA, AngryBeaver, Inter, and R3nin, which steal debit and credit cards from customers making purchases.
Ubisoft is investigating whether it suffered a breach after images of the company's internal software and developer tools were leaked online.
Mobile Virtual Network Operator Mint Mobile discloses a new data breach that exposed the personal information of its customers, including data that can be used to perform SIM swap attacks.
Researchers from McAfee discover Xamalicious, a previously unknown Android backdoor in 25 different malicious apps, infecting approximately 338,300 devices on Google Play.
Country: AR AU BR DE ES GB MX US

Description: St Vincent’s Health Australia, Australia’s largest non-profit healthcare provider is hit by a cyberattack this week, resulting in data being stolen from its networks.
National Amusements announces a data breach that affected more than 82,000 people.

Author: Cactus
Description: Coop Sverige is hit with a ransomware attack, whose responsibility is claimed by the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Threat actors linked to Russia
Target: Individuals in Ukraine and the West
Description: Google terminates 23 YouTube channels part of a coordinated influence operations linked to Russia, sharing content in Russian that was supportive of Russia and critical of Ukraine and the West.

Author: Threat actors linked to Turkey and Russia
Description: Google bans 1 Play developer and blocks 2 domains on Google News, part of a coordinated influence operations linked to Turkey and Russia, sharing content in Turkish that was supportive of Russia and critical of Ukraine.
Google terminates 3 YouTube channels part of a coordinated influence operation linked to Thailand, sharing content in Thai about Thai politicians and the Thai royal family.

Author: Threat actors linked to China
Description: Google terminates 1953 YouTube channels and 52 Blogger blogs, part of a coordinated influence operation linked to the People’s Republic of China (PRC), uploading content in Chinese and English about China and U.S. foreign affairs.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware claims responsibility for hacking the British Xeinadin accountancy firm and threatens to disclose the alleged stolen data.

HealthEC, a provider of health management solutions, suffers a data breach that impacts close to 4.5 million individuals who received care through one of the company's customers. 17 healthcare service providers and state-level health systems are impacted.
ProSmile Holdings issues a press release describing a recent data security incident resulting in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information
Retina Group of Washington files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company had been the target of a cyberattack.
Meridian Behavioral Healthcare (Meridian) filed a notice of data breach after discovering unauthorized activity within its computer system.
Clay County announces that it fell victim to a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Perell
Description: India’s state-owned telecom operator, Bharat Sanchar Nigam (BSNL), experiences a substantial data breach, placing the personal information of thousands of users at risk, after a threat actor, named Perell, claims possession of critical information related to BSNL’s fiber and landline users.

Author: DragonForce
Description: Yakult Australia, manufacturer of a probiotic milk drink, confirms experiencing a "cyber incident" to both the company's Australian and New Zealand IT systems. A threat actor named DragonForce claims responsibility for the attack and leaks 95 GB of data.

Integris Health patients in Oklahoma receive blackmail emails stating that their data was stolen in a cyberattack on the healthcare network, and if they did not pay an extortion demand, the data would be sold to other threat actors.

Author: UNC4841
Target: Organizations in the U.S. and APJ
Description: Network and email security firm Barracuda says it remotely patched all active Email Security Gateway (ESG) appliances on December 21 against CVE-2023-7102 and CVE-2023-7101,two zero-day bugs exploited by UNC4841 Chinese threat actors.
Downfall, a fan expansion for the popular Slay the Spire indie strategy game, is breached to push the Epsilon information stealer malware using the Steam update system.

Author: Homeland Justice
Description: The Albanian parliament is targeted by a cyber attack, whose responsibility is claimed by an Iran-linked threat group known as Homeland Justice.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Homeland Justice
Description: The same Iran-linked threat group claims responsibility for an attack against One Albania, a telecom company operating in the country.

The National Insurance Board (NIBTT), a key government agency in Trinidad and Tobago that runs the nation’s social security system, is hit with a ransomware attack that will limit its operations for at least the rest of the year.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple Threat Actors
Description: Researchers from Ahnlab discover a new campaign targeting poorly managed Linux SSH servers to install malware for cryptomining or carrying out distributed denial-of-service attacks.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware group claims to have hit the Abdali Hospital in Jordan and adds it to the list of victims on its Tor leak site.

Author: irleaks
Description: Threat actors are selling a trove of 160 million customer information records stolen from 23 Iranian insurance companies for approximately $75,000, via the hack of Expert Information Technologists (Fanavaran).
Scam Sniffer reports that around $3 million was lost to phishing scams on Christmas Day, using Google Ads to promote malicious sites delivering the MS Drainer.

Panasonic Avionics Corporation, a leading supplier of in-flight communications and entertainment systems, discloses a data breach affecting an undisclosed number of individuals after its corporate network was breached in December 2022.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: German hospital network Katholische Hospitalvereinigung Ostwestfalen (KHO) confirms that recent service disruptions at three hospitals (Franziskus Hospital Bielefeld, Sankt Vinzenz Hospital Rheda-Wiedenbrück, Mathilden Hospital Herford) were caused by a Lockbit ransomware attack.

Author: DragonForce
Description: The Ohio Lottery is forced to shut down some key systems after a cyberattack affected an undisclosed number of internal applications on Christmas Eve. The DragonForce ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Eagers Automotive, the largest operator of car dealerships in Australia and New Zealand, announces it suffered a cyberattack and was forced to halt trading on the stock exchange as it evaluates the impact of the incident. The Lockbit ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Cyber Toufan
Description: The Pro-Palestinian group Cyber Toufan claims to have breached dozens of Israeli entities amid the ongoing war in Gaza, promising to publish leaked information.
Transformative Healthcare discloses that Fallon Ambulance Services, a company it purchased in 2018, suffered a data breach that affected nearly one million people.

Author: Cyber Av3ngers
Description: Iranian hacktivists from the CyberAv3ngers group claim to be in possession and to be selling 1TB of data from Israel’s electricity infrastructures
Thunder Terminal, an on-chain trading platform, says that it thwarted an exploit that had targeted 114 wallets on its platform, preventing a $240,000 loss.
A new campaign empties Blockchain developers' wallets with fake "job interviews" using a malicious npm package.

Author: Forest Blizzard a.k.a. APT28, Fancy Bear, Strontium, Fighting Ursa, TA422, ITG05
Description: Ukraine's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) warns of a new phishing campaign that allowed Russia-linked hackers to deploy previously unseen malware, dubbed MASEPIE, on a network in under one hour.

Author: Multiple Threat Actors (Storm-0569, Storm-1113, Storm-1674 and Sangria Tempest)
Description: Microsoft disables the ms-appinstaller protocol, a feature intended to streamline app installation, after it discovered financially motivated hacking groups using it to distribute malware.
The Anna Jaques Hospital is hit with a cyber attack that temporarily forces to divert ambulances to other area hospitals.

Target: Prominent journalists in India including Siddharth Varadarajan, and Anand Mangnale
Description: Amnesty International reveals new details about the continued use of NSO Group’s highly invasive spyware Pegasus to target prominent journalists in India, exploiting the CVE-2023-41064 vulnerability.
Researchers from ESET discover a campaign using the Rugmi malware to deliver information stealers like Lumma Stealer, Vidar, RecordBreaker, and Rescoms.
Electrostim Medical Services (EMSI) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its computer system.
Reinsel Kuntz Lesher (RKL) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information that had been entrusted to the company.
Mountain Dermatology Specialists reports an email account breach that was detected on October 26, 2023.

Author: Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from AhnLab observe the Kimsuky Nation-state threat actor affiliated to North Korea, using spear-phishing attacks to deliver an assortment of backdoors and tools such as AppleSeed, Meterpreter, and TinyNuke to seize control of compromised machines.
Singaporean Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong posts a warning on social media about deepfake videos exploiting his voice and image for cryptocurrency scams.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to Bell Group.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to Tridon Australia

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The Shadowserver Foundation discover attempts to exploit CVE-2023-49070, a critical vulnerability affecting the Apache OFBiz open source enterprise resource planning (ERP) system.
The Better Business Bureau warns of online scams exploiting the scarcity of the Ozempic prescription drug
Essen Medical Associates (Essen Health Care) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s IT network.
Highlands Oncology Group files a notice of data breach after threat actors targeted the company through a ransomware attack.

Author: INC Ransom
Description: The U.S. division of Xerox Business Solutions (XBS) is compromised by the INC Ransom ransomware threat actor with a limited amount of personal information possibly exposed.

Author: Irleaks
Description: Irleaks claims to have broken into the systems of SnappFood, Iran's leading online food ordering service, and to have exfiltrated 3TB of highly sensitive data from 20 million user profiles (emails, passwords, phone numbers), 51 million users' addresses and 600,000 credit card records viat the StealC Infostealer
Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) is hit with a cyberattack that postpones the start of classes in one campus.
Threat actors try to break into Radioactive Waste Management (RWM) using LinkedIn lures.

Author: Belarusian Cyber-Partisans
Description: Belarusian hacktivists from the Belarusian Cyber-Partisans collective shut down BelTA the country's leading state-owned media outlet, claiming they had wiped the main website servers and backups. The group claims its actions were retaliation against President Alexander Lukashenko's propaganda campaign.
